Package com.uwgb.GBCoin.Model

Class TransactionHandler

java.lang.Object
com.uwgb.GBCoin.Model.TransactionHandler
public class TransactionHandler extends Object
The TransactionHandler is responsible for verifying transactions and adding and creating new coins

  • Constructor Details

    • TransactionHandler

  • Method Details

    • isValidTX

      public boolean isValidTX(Transaction transaction)
      main function to check if a given transaction is valid
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction we want to check
      Returns:
      true if the transaction passes all of our checks false otherwise if it fails the checks. The checks include: is a coin double spent, is a coin available to be spent, does a coin's signature match, and finally ensure that the transaction. Output sum is bigger than the transaction. Input sum

    • getTransactionFees

      public double getTransactionFees(List<Transaction> transactions)
      Method to get the transaction fees for all transactions in the list the transaction fee is the output sum minus the input sum which means the person who is paying i.e. the inputs decided to spend more than the outputs thus whatever is left over is implicitly the fee.
      Parameters:
      transactions - the list of transactions from which to calculate the total fee
      Returns:
      the total transaction fee for all transactions as a double

    • isCoinDoubleSpent

      private boolean isCoinDoubleSpent(Set<UTXO> claimedUTXO, Transaction.Input input)
      Method to check to see if a coin has been double spent
      Parameters:
      claimedUTXO - a set of all claimed utxo's
      input - the corresponding input transaction that lines up with the utxo
      Returns:
      false if the utxo based off of the input param is already in the set

    • isSignatureVerified

      private boolean isSignatureVerified(Transaction transaction, int index, Transaction.Input input)
      Method to check if the signature of the transaction matches with the utxo
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction to check
      index - the index of the input transaction
      input - the input transaction that needs to be verified against
      Returns:
      true if the signatures match up

    • isConsumedCoinAvailable

      private boolean isConsumedCoinAvailable(Transaction.Input input)
      Method to check if the consumed coin is available to spend if so, then it will exist in the utxo pool of transactions
      Parameters:
      input - the Transaction.Input that is available
      Returns:
      true if the utxo pool contains this utxo transaction false if it doesn't exist

    • handleTransactions

      public Transaction[] handleTransactions(Transaction[] transactions)
      Method to check for valid transactions then add and remove those coins
      Parameters:
      transactions - the transaction list we need to check
      Returns:
      all valid transactions

    • addCoinsToUTXOPool

      public void addCoinsToUTXOPool(Transaction transaction)
      Method to add new coins from a new transaction Since in Bitcoin, a transaction is consumed wholly and change is sent back as a new coin
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction we need to add coins for

    • removeConsumedCoins

      public void removeConsumedCoins(Transaction transaction)
      Method to remove the consumed coins
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction we need to remove used coins from
